snippet: Starting on Friday in Incheon, South Korea, athletes will compete in 439 events in 36 sports and disciplines, and the additional content is part of what makes the Asian Games truly Asian.
abstract: Asian Games of 2014 will include kabaddi and sepaktakraw, two sports unfamiliar to the West; kabaddi is a team contact sport developed in and dominated by India; sepaktakraw is a Southeast Asian game dominated by Thailand that combines volleyball and soccer.
lead_paragraph: Starting on Friday in Incheon, South Korea, athletes will compete in 439 events in 36 sports and disciplines, and the additional content is part of what makes the Asian Games truly Asian.

headline.main: At the Asian Games, Topsy-Turvy Sports Are Traditional, Too

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
